CatDescriptText: Carole Thompson, office worker, East Liberty and Ross Miller, construction worker, North Side, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 30, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Are you in favor of increasing the city wage tax to pay salaries for additional police officers in Pittsburgh?  Say, about 500 more?"  Ms. Thompson's answer reads: " Yes, because we really need it.  There are so many robberies and other crimes nowadays that more police protection is necessary." Mr. Miller's answer reads: "I don't think we need any more policemen, therefore, I'm not in favor of a tax increase."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Carole Thompson wearing eyeglasses and light colored coat with fur collar, standing in front of block building, Downtown; Portrait of Ross Miller wearing dark striped coat with upturned collar, standing in front of block wall, Downtown
